Package org.svvrl.goal.core.aut

Class Automaton

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractEditable
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.Automaton
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, Editable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractAltAutomaton, FSA, Game
public abstract class Automaton
extends AbstractEditable
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
An Automaton object contains a finite alphabet, a finite set of states, a finite set of transitions, and an acceptance condition. The alphabet can be AlphabetType.CLASSICAL or AlphabetType.PROPOSITIONAL. The label can be Position.OnState or Position.OnTransition. Transitions that have the same source state, destination state, and label will be considered the same in an automaton. As an automaton is also a directed graph and graph algorithms may search in a subgraph, this class provides an easy way to make a subgraph of an automaton. The function pushInvisibleLayer(Collection) can be used to hide a collection of states and transitions (including all related transitions of the states in the collection) temporarily. After a call to the function, the automaton will behave as if those hidden states and transitions are not in the automaton. The function popInvisibleLayer() can be used to make the last hidden states and transitions visible again.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai
See Also:
Serialized Form

      public void reorder()

    • getEpsilonPredecessors

      public StateSet getEpsilonPredecessors​(State s)
      Returns a set of states that can reach a specified state through only ε-transitions.
      Parameters:
      s - a state
      Returns:
      a set of states that can reach s through only ε-transitions

    • getEpsilonPredecessors

      public StateSet getEpsilonPredecessors​(StateSet set)
      Returns a set of states that can reach some state in a specified state set through only ε-transitions.
      Parameters:
      set - a state set
      Returns:
      a set of states that can reach some state in set through only ε-transitions

    • getPredecessorsWithEpsilon

      public StateSet getPredecessorsWithEpsilon​(State s, java.lang.String symbol)
      Returns the α-predecessors of a specified state where α is a symbol. The returned predecessors must be able to reach the specified state through ε-transitions and a transition labeled by the symbol.
      Parameters:
      s - a state
      symbol - a symbol
      Returns:
      a set of predecessors that can reach the specified state through ε-transitions and a transition labeled by the symbol

    • getPredecessorsWithEpsilon

      public StateSet getPredecessorsWithEpsilon​(StateSet set, java.lang.String symbol)
      Returns the α-predecessors of a specified state set where α is a symbol. The returned predecessors must be able to reach some state of the the specified state set through ε-transitions and a transition labeled by the symbol.
      Parameters:
      set - a state set
      symbol - a symbol
      Returns:
      a set of predecessors that can reach some state in set through ε-transitions and a transition labeled by the symbol

    • dumpSuccessorMap

      public BinaryMap<State,​java.lang.String,​StateSet> dumpSuccessorMap()
      Returns a map from a state and a symbol to a set of successors of the state with respect to the symbol. The returned map is a snapshot. Changes of transitions and states in this automaton hereafter will not be reflected to the returned map. If this automaton has labels on state, the symbol passed to the returned map is always an empty string.
      Returns:
      a map from a state and a symbol to a set of successors of the state with respect to the symbol

    • dumpPredecessorMap

      public BinaryMap<State,​java.lang.String,​StateSet> dumpPredecessorMap()
      Returns a map from a state and a symbol to a set of predecessors of the state with respect to the symbol. The returned map is a snapshot. Changes of transitions and states in this automaton hereafter will not be reflected to the returned map. If this automaton has labels on state, the symbol passed to the returned map is always an empty string.
      Returns:
      a map from a state and a symbol to a set of predecessors of the state with respect to the symbol

      Sets the initial state of this automaton to the specified state only.
      Parameters:

      public void addInitialState​(State state)

      state - a state becoming an initial state

    • recomputeTransitionMaps

      public void recomputeTransitionMaps()
      Re-computes the transition maps for cache.

    • createTransition

      public Transition createTransition​(State from, State to, java.lang.String symbol)
      Creates a transition to the automaton. The returned transition is guaranteed to be in this automaton.
      Parameters:
      from - the source state of the transition
      to - the destination state of the transition
      symbol - the label on the transition
      Returns:
      a new transition from from to to with label symbol if there is no such transition, the existing transition if this automaton has a transition from from to to with the label symbol, null if from is null, to is null, or the symbol is not valid

    • newTransition

      protected abstract Transition newTransition​(int id, State from, State to)
      Creates a new instance of a transition.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique transition ID
      from - the source state of the transition
      to - the destination state of the transition
      Returns:
      a new transition with ID id from from to to

    • newTransition

      protected Transition newTransition​(int id, State from, State to, Transition base)
      Creates a new instance of a transition and makes the transition inherit properties of another transition.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the returned transition
      from - the source state of the returned transition
      to - the destination state of the returned transition
      base - the base transition of the returned transition
      Returns:
      a new transition that has ID id, source state from, destination state to, and all other properties inherited from the base transition

    • addTransition

      public boolean addTransition​(Transition t)
      Inserts a transition created outside to this automaton. The transition will not be added if there is another existing transition (1) with the same ID or (2) with the same starting state, ending state, and label.
      Parameters:
      t - the transition to be added to this automaton
      Returns:
      true if the transition is inserted successfully

    • setCompleteTransitions

      public void setCompleteTransitions​(boolean b)
      Sets the current flag of completing transitions. The transitions will be updated accordingly. Whether overlaps of transition labels are allowed or not depends on the option Preference.O_TRANSITION_SIMPLIFICATION_ALLOW_OVERLAP.
      Parameters:
      b - true for making the transitions complete, false for making the transitions simplified

    • setCompleteTransitions

      public void setCompleteTransitions​(boolean b, boolean overlap)
      Sets the current flag of completing transitions. The transitions will be updated accordingly.
      Parameters:
      b - true for making the transitions complete, false for making the transitions simplified
      overlap - indicates whether overlaps of transition labels are allowed or not

    • completeTransitions

      public void completeTransitions()
      Makes transitions complete if they are simplified. Does nothing if transitions are complete already.

      Parameters:
      f - the source state
      t - the destination state

    • simplifyTransitions

      public void simplifyTransitions()
      Simplifies transitions if they are complete. Does nothing if transition are simplified already. Whether overlaps of transition labels are allowed or not depends on the option Preference.O_TRANSITION_SIMPLIFICATION_ALLOW_OVERLAP.

      public void simplifyTransitions​(boolean overlap)

      Parameters:
      overlap - indicates whether overlaps of transition labels are allowed or not

    • isMergable

      protected boolean isMergable​(Transition t1, Transition t2)
      Returns true if merging two transitions will not (1) affect the language of the automaton due to the change of the acceptance condition, or (2) discard incompatible user properties on the transitions.
      Parameters:
      t1 - a transition
      t2 - a transition
      Returns:
      true if merging the two transitions will not affect the language of the automaton due to the change of the acceptance condition or discard incompatible user properties on the transitions

      ts - a set of transitions
      Returns:
      the partitioned transitions
